unit: Unit 8 | Inference for Categorical Data: Chi-Square
title: The Null Hypothesis
question_text: In hypothesis testing, the null hypothesis is a statement of

choices.text: What the experiment is trying to prove or show by applying some kind of treatment on one or more variables.
The probability of obtaining the experimental results purely by chance.
No difference from what one would normally expect if there were no effect of the experimental treatment.
The relative effectiveness of a treatment applied to a randomly selected group of subjects.

solution:
The null hypothesis ${H}_{0}$ is always the statement of “no difference.” It states the status quo of a population or sample if no treatment were applied, or if an applied treatment had no effect.

Explanation of Distractors

Choice 'A' is incorrect; it describes the alternative hypothesis.

Choice 'B' is incorrect; this gives a description of the $p$-value, not the null hypothesis.

Choice 'C' is incorrect; validity of an experiment is usually built in during the design phase of an experiment.

Choice 'E' is incorrect; the null hypothesis does not address the effectiveness of any treatment.
